alert.note: Alert for Catawba (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 6:53PM EST until January 09 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Catawba and Burke County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 649 PM EST, Rain gauges reported heavy rainfall of 2 to 4 inches over the past 18 hours in the advisory area. Runoff from this activity, and from heavy rainfall upstream, will allow high water conditions to continue through most of the evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hickory, Longview, Icard, Hildebran and Mountain View. - Flooding is most likely along the Henry Fork near the Henry River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
